danfulea.db

Class DatabaseAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.db.DatabaseAgent

  • public class DatabaseAgent
extends java.lang.Object

    The DatabaseAgent class handles basic database operations: connection, creation or removal of database and tables, select to retrieve database data in form of data and column names vectors, insert, delete and update data into tables.

    Supports derby embedded, MySql and PostgreSQL connections. Supports most used data types like: integer, double precision, varchar, clob, real, etc.

    Be advise that MySQL connector is licensed under GNU-GPL copyleft license which means that by using it, you can only create free software and not any kind of software (proprietary software included)! Also, using derby embedded means the derby engine cannot run in multiple instances of JVM, i.e. cannot run two or more instances of the same application because the previous one has already established a connection to embedded derby. To avoid this, use MySQL DB or PostgreSQL DB or use Derby Network Server. However, using embedded derby can be very useful when we do not want to install additional software (such as MySQL DB, PostgreSQL DB etc) in order for our application to run. Just use embedded derby.jar and you are good to go. The price is one instance of application is allowed!

    It is intended to be fast therefore the standard scenario is to use tables having a column created with auto-increment and primary key option. All other columns must have no indexes. Alternatively, you always have to have an integer type column which mimics the auto-incremented standard column. Generally, using synchronized to control database access is not a good idea. The database has all kinds of internal mechanisms to control concurrent access, so it is best to use them instead.

    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 04 AUG. 2016

      • ID_CONNECTION

        public static int ID_CONNECTION
        Connection ID pointing to various database management systems (DMS) such as derby, MySQL or PostgreSQL. It points to embedded derby by default.

      • dataFolderUsedByDerbyEmbedded

        public static java.lang.String dataFolderUsedByDerbyEmbedded
        Specifies where embedded derby database is located relative to application folder. The default value is Data.

        Stores table column types as Java class

      • columnType

        private static java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> columnType
        Stores table column types as SQL types. This is used for operations like insert or update where PreparedStatement methods like setString or setInt are used.

      • derbyClosed

        private static boolean derbyClosed
        internal flag to check if derby is closed.

      • createDerbyDatabaseInDataFolder

        public static void createDerbyDatabaseInDataFolder(java.lang.String dbName,
                                                   java.lang.String user,
                                                   java.lang.String pass)
        Creates derby database in Data folder (specified by dataFolderUsedByDerbyEmbedded) relative to the application folder.
        Parameters:
        dbName - database name to be created
        user - user name, can be null
        pass - password, can be null

      • deleteDatabase

        public static void deleteDatabase(java.lang.String dbName,
                                  java.lang.String user,
                                  java.lang.String pass)
        Deletes a database. It doesn't work for embedded derby; in this case, you can manually delete the folder which contains the data!
        Parameters:
        dbName - database name to be deleted
        user - user name, can be null
        pass - password, can be null

      • deleteTable

        public static void deleteTable(java.lang.String dbName,
                               java.lang.String table,
                               java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String pass)
        Deletes a table from database.
        Parameters:
        dbName - database name
        table - table name to be deleted
        user - user name, can be null
        pass - password, can be null

      • createTable

        public static void createTable(java.lang.String dbName,
                               java.lang.String table,
                               java.lang.String[] cname,
                               java.lang.String[] ctype,
                               java.lang.String[] cindexes,
                               java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String pass)
        Creates a table inside database.
        Parameters:
        dbName - database name
        table - table name to be created
        cname - table column names stored in an array of strings.
        ctype - table column types stored in an array of strings. Example: {"integer", "DOUBLE PRECISION", "VARCHAR(59)", "CLOB"}. Note that the corresponding CLOB type in PostgreSQL is TEXT.
        cindexes - table column indexes stored in an array of strings. To mark the primary key column use "Y". Example: {"Y", "N", "N", "N"}.
        user - user name, can be null
        pass - password, can be null

      • restartPK

        public static void restartPK(java.lang.String dbName,
                             java.lang.String table,
                             java.lang.String user,
                             java.lang.String pass,
                             java.lang.String pkColumn,
                             int newInt)
        Restart the primary key with a new int value.
        Parameters:
        dbName - database name
        table - table name
        user - user name, can be null
        pass - password, can be null
        pkColumn - primary key column name
        newInt - new starting integer

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String dbURL,
                                                java.lang.String user,
                                                java.lang.String password)
        Setting up connection. For derby embedded the driver is org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDriver and the protocol: jdbc:derby:. For MySQL, the driver is com.mysql.jdbc.Driver and the protocol: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/. For PostgreSQL, the driver is org.postgresql.Driver and the protocol: jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/.
        Parameters:
        dbURL - database name to connect. For derby embedded, dbURL must be the full path. For MySQL or PostgreSQL this is simply the name, for example: testdb
        user - user name, can be null
        password - password, can be null
        Returns:
        the connection to database

      • initDerby

        private static java.sql.Connection initDerby(java.lang.String dbURL,
                                             java.lang.String user,
                                             java.lang.String password)
                                      throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                             java.sql.SQLException
        Set-up the connection for embedded derby. Derby connector jar (derby.jar) must be placed in the application class-path.
        Parameters:
        dbURL - passed by constructor
        user - passed by constructor
        password - passed by constructor
        Returns:
        the connection to database
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - can throw this java exception
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - can throw this java exception
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - can throw this java exception
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this java exception

      • disableDerbyLogFile

        public static java.io.OutputStream disableDerbyLogFile()
        Do not want to create derby log file. This must be public and static. If, for some reason, you want derby logs then comment-out this method as well as the following line inside initDerby method: System.setProperty("derby.stream.error.method", "danfulea.db.DatabaseAgent.disableDerbyLogFile");
        Returns:
        a null OutputStream

      • shutdownDerby

        public static void shutdownDerby()
        Shuts down derby.

      • select

        public static void select(java.sql.Connection con,
                          java.lang.String command)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This is the KEY method for all SELECT queries. It populates the required members, such as colNumeVec or dataVec, with data for displaying the result.
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        command - the command containing the SELECT query. Example: select * from my_table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

      • setPreparedStatement

        private static void setPreparedStatement(java.sql.PreparedStatement pstmt,
                                         int ival,
                                         java.lang.String val,
                                         int tvalue)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the PreparedStatement for insert/update in complete agreement with column type. For example, it knows when to use pstmt.setString or pstmt.setDouble.
        Parameters:
        pstmt - The PreparedStatement to be properly set for insert/update operation.
        ival - the question mark placeholder index representing the pair columnName-columnType (starting with 1)
        val - the value to be set at that column
        tvalue - the column type. This is of java.sql.Types type.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

      • insert

        public static void insert(java.sql.Connection con,
                          java.lang.String tabel,
                          java.lang.String[] cvalue,
                          java.lang.Integer[] tvalue,
                          java.lang.String[] value)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a row in database table.
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        cvalue - the array of column names
        tvalue - the array of column types
        value - the array of values to be inserted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

      • update

        public static void update(java.sql.Connection con,
                          java.lang.String tabel,
                          java.lang.String[] cvalue,
                          java.lang.Integer[] tvalue,
                          java.lang.String[] value,
                          java.lang.String IDLink,
                          java.lang.String IDValue)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates a row in database table. This is based on a column name as reference where update takes place. The reference is passed in WHERE clause, e.g. ID = 1 where ID is the the reference column name link (IDLink) and 1 is its corresponding reference value (IDValue).
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        cvalue - the array of column names where values will be updated
        tvalue - the array of column types where values will be updated
        value - the array of values to be updated
        IDLink - the reference column name used as link
        IDValue - the reference value for corresponding link
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

      • delete

        public static void delete(java.sql.Connection con,
                          java.lang.String tabel,
                          java.lang.String IDLink,
                          java.lang.String IDValue)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes a row from database table. This is based on a column name as reference where delete takes place. The reference is passed in WHERE clause, e.g. ID = 1 where ID is the reference column name link (IDLink) and 1 is its corresponding reference value (IDValue).
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        IDLink - the reference column name used as link
        IDValue - the reference value for corresponding link
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

      • delete

        public static void delete(java.sql.Connection con,
                          java.lang.String tabel,
                          java.lang.String[] IDLink,
                          java.lang.String[] IDValue)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes multiple rows from database table. This is based on a column name as reference where delete takes place. The reference is passed in WHERE clause, e.g. ID = 1 where ID is the reference column name link (IDLink) and 1 is its corresponding reference value (IDValue).
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        IDLink - the reference column name array used as link
        IDValue - the reference value array for corresponding link
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception

                             java.lang.String tabel)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes all rows from database table
        Parameters:
        con, - the connection to database
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - can throw this exception
